creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description: three very large archways, cut with various smaller arches on two levels and surmounted by free-standing arches; goats and figures at right in middle ground; figures with a wagon and two horses in foreground; other figures and mule in LLC
inscription:
Signature, Title and Inscription

on back, in pencil: [P3086-02]
portfolio: From From Le Vedute di Roma (The Views of Rome)
provenance:
Private collection, New England
Childs Gallery, Boston
signed: LLC, in the plate: [Cavalier Piranesi F]; LRC, in the image: [Veduta degli avanzi del Tablino / della Casa aurea di Nerone detti / volgarmente il Tempio della Pace / muro da A.B. fatto pr.ma del restante della Fabbrica / C. Anfiteatro Flavio]
title: View of the Remains of the Dining Room of Nero's Golden House, commonly called the Temple of Peace
